[{"id":"b9f3b763-647c-41d4-8a1a-6dc355cfa33a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: resolveList","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4dc96da8-4c36-4914-b9e9-ed861dfeb71a","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"resolveList","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function is a recursive resolution utility designed to trace a variable or definition back to its absolute origin. While ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"resolve","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" often performs a single layer of resolution, ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"resolveList","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is built to drill through multiple levels of indirection. It specifically handles "pointer" definitions—such as variables, function parameters, and return values—following their recorded value points until it reaches a terminal, concrete definition (like a specific function or class).","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"fff7d723-0245-4d6a-bd63-ee3431e398e4","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"In Python, data often passes through a "chain of custody." For example, a value might be assigned to variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"A","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which is passed as a parameter to function ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"B","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", which then returns it as variable ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"C","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":". To understand what ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"C","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" actually contains, the analyzer must be able to follow the breadcrumbs backwards through every assignment and function call. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"resolveList","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" automates this traversal, ensuring the analyzer doesn't stop at a temporary name but finds the actual object being referenced.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6023d458-8c21-49d9-b934-7a989409e906","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it Retrieval:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It looks up the formal ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"Definition","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" object for the starting namespace (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"calleeNs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"534fd89b-7253-4c32-9b8d-e03e6e0df6e8","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Base Case:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the definition is a terminal type (like a Function or Class), it simply returns that namespace in a list.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3db38bb4-481b-4013-937a-2a0937d6e8a0","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Recursive Expansion:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the definition is a reference type (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"NAME_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"PARAM_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":"):","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"48645a2e-dcab-4ad0-81c1-92224d7d0ecf","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It retrieves the most recent "points-to" values for that variable (","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"get_last_point_value","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":").","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"debadfa3-4941-4b0c-99ef-c199b74d5368","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It recursively calls ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"resolveList","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"each","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of those potential values.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"ed1ce56f-9f25-462b-a04e-d667322926ef","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It uses ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"reduce","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to flatten the results into a single comprehensive list of final targets.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"e38aba14-29c6-4cfc-a316-2d60a77c73a7","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Error Handling:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If no definition or values are found, it returns an empty list, safely terminating the recursion.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3928c59e-048f-46f0-80f6-6d00062d67bf","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example
